definition: Information a program gives to the user, such as text
A single line of code that performs an action
A group of letters, symbols and/or numbers inside double quotation marks
The exact spelling, symbols, and order of code
A note that the computer ignores
When the computer encounters something unexpected in your code
A multi-line comment at the top of a program surrounded by `"""` marks
Storing information in a variable
Information the program receives from the user
A storage container for information
Information that a function needs to know in order to run
A named code action that can be used in a program
A collection of code from outside the program
A written explanation of how to use code
The category a piece of information belongs to
A number with a decimal point
A number written without a decimal point
A value you can literally see
Join two strings together with the + operator
Repeat a string a certain number of times with the * operator
Treat one data type like another
Changes a variable based on the current value
Decrease a variable by an amount
A piece of code that produces a value
Increase a variable by an amount
A special literal that means "no value"
Information given back by a function
Asks a yes or no question

name: Equal to (==)
definition: Are the two values the same?
Runs a section of code when the condition is true

name: Not equal to (!=)
definition: Are the two values different?
Compares two values and gives a yes or no answer

name: Greater than (>)
definition: Is the left value bigger than the right value?

name: Less than (<)
definition: Is the left value smaller than the right value?
Runs the first section of code where the condition is true
When all prior conditions are false, runs a section of code when the condition is true
When all prior conditions are false, runs a section of code as a last alternative
A section of code that might get run
An expression with more than one comparison operator
A conditional inside another conditional
A library with code to create unpredictable values
Multiplies a number by itself some number of times
Rounds the quotient down to a whole number after division
Calculates the remainder after division
True if all parts are True
A True or False value
Combines or modifies a boolean
Gives the opposite boolean value
True if one or more parts are True
Using a boolean as a complete condition
A boolean expression made of up of other boolean expressions
Something a program can do
Composing a system with independent parts
A formal review of the successes and failures of recent work
The set of work planned for a specific time period
An optional goal which won't cause the product to fail if it's not reached
A unique name or number for the state of a product at a particular time
A loop with a condition that will always be True
One repetition of a loop
Repeats a section of code until a condition is no longer True
Immediately end a loop
Immediately end an iteration
A clause following a loop that runs unless the loop ends with break
A piece of information an object knows about itself
A blueprint for creating something specific
A specific copy created from a class
A function that belongs to an instance
Horizontal (x) and vertical (y) position
Keeps a window open and updated
An on-screen graphic based on an image
A library used to create programs with graphics
A container for displaying graphics
A variable that stores a value that does not change
An on-screen graphic based on a string
Rapid changes that the human eye perceives as motion
Attribute that controls how fast the images from a spritesheet change
One still image within an animation, usually one iteration of a loop
Attributes that control how fast and what direction an instance moves on screen
An image designed to be broken apart and used as an animation
The amount of time between two moments
A single action that occurs as a result of the user
A cycle of user input and program output that influence each other
An unchanging value representing a key on the keyboard
Information that is remembered by the program
When sprites touch or overlap
Assigning more than one variable with the same operator
A loop that runs a specific number of times
A variable whose value changes based on the iteration of a loop
A sequence of integers with a start and an end
The first value in a range
The amount that a range counts by
A grouping of information
A value in a collection at a position
A loop that iterates over each element in a collection
Operate on the elements of a collection, one at a time in sequential order
A changeable collection of ordered elements
The zero-based position of an element in a collection
The number of elements in a collection
A question about an element in a collection
Add an element to the end of a list
Take an element out of a list by its index
Copy all elements of one list to the end of another list
Add an element to a list at a position
Take an element out of a list by its value
The largest value in a collection
The smallest value in a collection
Arrange the elements in a collection in ascending order
Check whether two different variables refer to the same data
Create a new list by joining two lists together
Check whether two lists contain all of the same elements in the same order
Create a new list from multiple copies of an existing list
A name that points to data
A single letter, number, punctuation mark, or symbol represented as a string
Unable to be changed after it is created
Zero or more sequential characters in a string
Create a new collection by copying a sequence of elements from an existing collection
Two or more sequential characters that have special meaning when combined
Join the elements of a list into a string
A substring that is used to mark a division between other strings
Split a string into a list of substrings
A character used for spacing, such as a space, tab, or newline
Treating uppercase and lowercase letters as distinct

A key-value pair represented as a tuple
A collection that contains other collections
The way data is organized to represent the relationships between information
A series of keys or indexes each surrounded by square brackets
A program that provides access to information over a computer network
A program that gets information from a server and uses it to complete a task

name: URL (Uniform Resource Location)
definition: The address of information on a computer network

name: HTTP (HyperText Transfer Protocol)
definition: A set of rules for sending and receiving information over a computer network
A message sent from a client to a server, asking for a information
A reply message from a server back to a client containing information that was requested by the client

name: JSON (JavaScript Object Notation)
definition: A common data format used to exchange information over a computer network

name: Web API (Web Application Programming Interface)
definition: The set of rules for interacting with an HTTP server on the internet
Additional information sent with a request as part of the URL
An integer value that indicates whether a request was successful and why
The number of requests a server will accept from one client within a time period
A unique identifying value that proves a client is allowed to make a request to a server
